page.title: 15Churches in Meltham
page.content:
{St. Bartholomew's Church, Meltham} The first{church}was built in{1651 and the present one was built in{1756. The{vicar}today is{Canon Peter Spivey and he has been here for{25}years. There is the date stone from the old {church}in the porch and there is a carving on the pulpit which was part of the old{church.}It was the only {church}consecrated while Oliver Cromwell ruled the country.
{St.James the Apostle, Meltham Mills The first{church}was built in{1835 and was used until{1985}as a{Youth {Club.}The present{church}was built in {1845}and was paid for by Joseph Brook, a local millowner. It is being {completely refurbished}in{1985}so that it can be used by different groups {every day}of the week.The{vicar}is called{Rev.Mr.David Turner.
